physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was asymptomatic with slightly impaired kidney function (serum creatinine 1.3 mg/dl, creatinine clearance 87 ml/min per 1.73 m^2 body surface) upon initial examination at age 28.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's kidney function deteriorated, resulting in complete ischemic infarction of the left kidney after the initial operation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Increase in urinary noradrenaline excretion and detection of a 2-cm mass in the right adrenal gland confirmed as pheochromocytoma through histology.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The left carotid body tumor (CBT) grew slightly over the years without any reported symptoms.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At age 37, catecholamines were reported to be normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No noted changes in other head and neck paragangliomas; they did not grow over 8 years.
